intro: Benthamia spiralis var. dissimulata, commonly known as the spiral benthamia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, spirally twisted stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from pale yellow to orange. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Its unique morphology makes it a distinctive species within the Aizoaceae family. It is often found growing in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, where it plays a role in stabilizing the local ecosystem.
